result.execSummary:
The defendant Ker Thao was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintaine FTE and/or school and if not must complete 10 hours community service per week.

SAFE program
Counseling

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

of Preliminary Examination

Case called: 11:35am.  Clerk: Denise. INCLUDES 14CF446, 14CF474, 14CM439. State appears by ADA Lesli Pluster. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Kat Jackan. Crt proceeds with Waiver of Prelim in 14CF446. Waiver of Prelim. filed.  Court questions deft as to waiver. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  Crt proceeds with Plea. *VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI ct 2 (bj) 14CF446-crt grants. State moves to DRI ct 1 (burglary); ct 3 (theft); ct 4 (crim damage); ct 5 (bj); ct 7 (theft) & ct 8 (bj) 14CM474- crt grants. State moves to DRI ct 2 (dc/domestic) 14CM439- crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - ct 1 (poss meth) 14CF446; ct 2 (bj/felony); ct 6 (bj/felony); ct 9 (crim damage) - 14CF474; ct 1 (crim damage/domestic) 14CM439. Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Atty Jackan makes statement. Defendant makes statement. COURT ORDERS: 14CF474- ct 9 (crim damage) - 9 months MCJ w/huber if eligible for work, school, child care, treatment; - sentence to commence immediately; credit 90 days; Court Costs.
COURT FURTHER ORDERS: All other counts - SWH -4 yrs probation, concurrent. CONDITIONS: Safe Program; AODA; Counseling; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school and if not must complete 10 hrs Community Service per week; Court Costs; Domestic Surcharge; DNA Surcharge in each case. Crt informs & defendant signs Voting Ineligibility Acknowledgement. Adjourned: 11:50pm.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
